dct_alternative_sm: Theatrvm orbis terrarvm Abrahami OrtelI Antverp. geographi regii. tabvlis aliqvot novis vitaq. avctoris illvstratvm
dct_description_sm: First uniformly sized and systematically collected set of maps by different mapmakers (partial list below, in order of appearance); acknowledged as the first atlas.
Title translation: The Theatre Of The Whole World: Set Forth By That Excellent Geographer Abraham Ortelius.
First 2 and last 3 pages blank (included in page description).
Engraved title page, illustrations, and head and tail-pieces throughout.
Dedication to: Abrahami Ortelii quem urbs urbium Antuerpia edidit, Rex Regum Philippus ...
Engraving of Ortelius: Spectandum dedit Ortelius mortalib orbem, Orbi spectandium Galleus Ortelium. Papius

Indexes: Index tabularum huius operis, sive inscriptionum earundem; Quoniam vero plures regiones aut insulae in his tabulis descriptae sunt, quam in earundem titulis continentur; visum nobisfuit operae pretium, eas hoc altero indice etiam studiosis indicare; Regionum insularumque huius parergi index; Nomenclator Ptolemaicus; omnia locorum vocabula quae in tota Ptolemaei Geographia occurrunt, continens: ad fidem Graeci codicis purgatus; & in ordinem non minus utilem quam elegantem digestus.
Descriptive text on versos of maps.
Illustrations of figures on xvij and xviij: Ordines sacri Romani Imp: ab Ottone III Institut.
dct_rights_sm: Images from the The Renaissance Exploration Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
dct_rightsHolder_sm: This work has been identified as being free of known restrictions under copyright law, including all related and neighboring rights. You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.
